  • Description: No spill. Hazmat, undeclared (no DOT labels/markings on outer packaging, no Overpack label). Torn fiberboard box. One 76lb SAFT No. 414975 Mod. 409CH2 NiCad Battery Assy. Note: inner packaging (also a fiberboard box) has UNPOP, diamond label, UN number, and Proper Shipping Name. No OP-950A, OP-900, or HAZ SVC code.

item.title: Report X-2024070222
item.description:
Report X-2024070222

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-02
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Spill. Hazmat, undeclared (no DOT labels/markings) and overweight (100lb. See 49CFR 173.27(f)(2)(iii) for LQ weight limit and FXG hazmat shipping guide page 8 for fully regulated weight limit). Leaking fiberboard box. 10x1gal Natures Pure 27% Hydrogen peroxide. 0.1 gal loss from failed safety seal below cap of one bottle. Please note that 1.800.633.8253 (found on product) was called and a request was sent to sds@ambipar.com for the SDS. Report will be updated when more information becomes available.

  • City: ANCHORAGE

  • Description: On 7/1/2024 at approximately 1200, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 261690 at the ramp faiility in Anchorage, reporting a dangeorus goods spill. The shipment consisted one fiberboard box containig 4 plastic drums, individually packaged inside of smaller fiberboard box. One of the plastic drums leaked from the closure, resulting in spillage. This shipment was prepared under IATA Special Provision A197 and did not shipped as fully regulated DG. The shipper will be contacted for further disposition.

item.title: Report E-2024070035
item.description:
Report E-2024070035

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-01
  • City: Chandler
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PACIFIC SCIENTIFIC ENERGETIC MATERIALS COMPANY (CALIFORNIA) LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 1, 2024, we received a package from Meggitt Safety Systems. The package that we received contained a Non-classified explosive material, that should have been shipped on a DOT-SP 8451 special permit pipe. The material arrived to our facility in a standard Uline 12x12x12 fiberboard box. These boxes are not UN popped for Hazardous materials. Inside that box was a FedEx "Small Box", that contained paperwork and 7 live explosive parts. Once opened the package was separated into different holding area for examination. As this was a return shipment to out facility, thankfully the parts were sealed in the factory ESD bags with labels. There were no hazardous material labels affixed to the outside of the container. No DG forms were completed. Because of the untested nature of the parts, they were required to be shipped in a DOT-SP 8451 special permit pipe. That pipe, per the permit should be, either a 4" or 6" schedule 80 seamless pipe, with closures at both ends, rated for containment of 25 g PETN. Also, the specific label should have read, Articles, explosive, n.o.s (*), 1.4E.

item.title: Report X-2024070126
item.description:
Report X-2024070126

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-28
  • City: OCEANSIDE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package is an RTS from station 814. The exterior packaging had no orientation arrows, and no limited quantity diamond label on the FedEx repack box. The box is wet and hardened on the underside. Inside, a lot of paper filling materials were used. A clear plastic hazmat waste bag was used to contain the inner box that the shipment originally came with. The bag was secured haphazardly with a bunch of tape. The original outer box is wet all over and a diamond cut mark can be seen. The place where the limited quantity label used to be. This can be verified from the spidr image of the original package when it was picked up. Reviewing the DPR of the package, the package was not flagged as a dangerous goods, when in fact, 3 items of 2 different limited quantity was found. The original contents were 2 qty of 1 gallon metal container of Clear Guard EF, 1 metal can of Solvent Thinner, 1 qty 8 oz plastic container of Copper C Metal Coating, 1 qty of 8 oz Gold C Metal Coating, and 20fl oz high volume low pressure gravity feed spray gun. All items are products of Sculpt Nouveau. 1 container of Clear Guard EF was dented and the plastic seal for the lid came off and spill 3/4 of its contents. The Solvent Thinner was also dented and spilled from the cap around half of its content. The other gallon of Clear Guard EF was wet but salvageable, so are the metal coating, the content of the spray gun can be salvaged but the packaging is ruined. The package did not get a DG Nav Dangerous Goods Report when it was initially discovered but instead removed the Limited quantity diamond label and flagged the package non-hazardous and then RTS the package completely, including the damaged LQ.

item.title: Report X-2024070182
item.description:
Report X-2024070182

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-28
  • City: BATON ROUGE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The package was found in the truck by the package handler from the night previous night. The package handler didn't notice the hazmat on the package because the label evaporated, and the box was torn and crushed. We had to research for the label and thankfully matched the package with the UN Number associated with the bottle. The two bottles that had ethanolamine, were found leaking from the bottom of the bottle. Seem as though there was no inner packing inside the package to protect the product. Being placed in a red bin and being held at the station. More pictures provided for additional information.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A Veolia employee was offloading a pallet from a trailer at Veolia's 10 day intransit facility in Menomonee Falls, WI when they noticed a spill of material upon moving a pallet. The bags on the pallet were poorly shrink wrapped, allowing for the material to shift due to vibrations while in transit resulting in tears to the bags. One bag released contents estimated to be in a quantity of approximately 10 lbs of hazardous waste. No injuries or chemical exposures were reported. The bags were overpacked for continued transportation to the disposal facility.

USING DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEETS RESPONDER CAREFULLY TRANSFERED THE HAZMAT ONTO A SPILL TRAY LINED WITH GREEN BAG AND CLEANED UP THE SURROUNDING AREA. THEN BROUGHT THE PACKAGE BACK TO THE DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2024070123
item.description:
Report X-2024070123

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-21
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: 12 HOUR RESPONDER SUMMONED TO RECYCLE CHUTE FOR AN OPEN BOX WITH LEAKING CONTENTS. RESPONDER DONNED PROPER PPE, CONSULTED DECISION TREE RESPONSE SHEETS, TRANSPORTED THE PKG BACK TO THE DMP AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. THE SIDE OF THE BOX WAS TORN, AND THE PAIL INSIDE WAS PROTRUDING FROM THE BOX. THE PAIL LID WAS SLIGHTLY AJAR, AND POWDER WAS LEAKING OUT. THE PAIL HAD A 5.1 OXIDIZER DIAMOND HAZARD LABEL, "UN 2468" "TRICLOROISOCYANURIC ACID, DRY" PRINTED ON THE PAIL. THERE WERE NO INDICATIONS OF A DANGEROUS GOOD ON THE OUTSIDE CARTON OR THERMAL LABEL. THE BOX HAD NO MANUFACTURER MARKS, UN SPEC MARKS, OR ANY INDICATION OF THE BOX STRENGTH. SHIPMENT CALLED INTO HMSC AS AN UNDECLARED HAZMAT. PKG AWAITING CLEARANCE FOR DMP DAMAGE PROCESSING IN ETT.

  • Description: On June 21, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of paint was punctured in transit and released approximately 25-gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from TPM Group (TPM) to remediate the impacted site. TPM identified the impacted areas of trailer that would need to be power washed and moved the trailer to the R+L washing station. The crew removed as much pigment from the paint as they could and moved onto power wash the pavement that was impacted. The total waste resulted in 2 drums of waste and one over pack for the damaged container.

The team was dispatched and arrived at 2230ET and found the a 5 gallon drums lid had come off and the liquid had splashed over the top. They then removed the container and put it into a salvage drum and wiped up any residue found and disposed of the absorbents in the appropriate manor. The result was less than a gallon released. The clean up was complete at 0330.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The driver arrived at his destination where he noticed liquid dripping from trailer the driver then put down some absorbent pads and notified the facility. The onsite team and created a containment and then preceded to get a team together to enter the trailer. They were eventually able to get a crew that was trained to enter the trailer. The team showed up at 0830 to begin unloading and cleaning up any residue as needed. The crew discovered a drum with a pin hole they removed the lid and discovered that it was mostly full of wags and very little liquid. We believe that the wrags were blocking the hole and when in transit they would move around allowing it to leek ocasinaly. The crew then placed it into a salvage drum and cleaned up and disposed of the adsorbents and rags used properly. the clean up was completed by 1130.

All other drums were secured to the pallet and will continue to the destination. The leaking drum was overpacked into a 55-gallon metal drum for disposal.

  • Description: Driver stopped at rest area to take a break and to check on his load. When the driver walked around he noticed a drip coming from his trailer onto the drive tire he then though down some absorbent. The driver than called our emergency response line and a team was dispatched out at approximately 0845. The crew arrived at 1100 to investigate they found 3 drums that the lids were not secured tightly. The then unloaded the trailer to gain access to the containers wiping up any residue on the floor as they went. The 3 drums lids and rings were then tightened securely. The absorbents used to clean up the residue were then disposed of properly. The crew was done at 1700.

  • Description: On June 28th during the PM sort a package contained 2 glass bottles of UN1267, PETROLEUM CRUDE OIL, 3, III was found with signs of leakage. One of the glass bottles inside was found broken and the entire contents leaked out. The bottles were in a plastic bag filled with vermiculite, however the bag was unable to contain all of the spill. The package as placed into a salvage drum and the shipper contacted for disposition.

item.description:
Report X-2024070078

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-03T15:13:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-24
  • City: MC ALLEN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: HAZMAT RESPONDER DISCOVERED DAMAGED AND LEAKING CARTON ON PALLET OUTSIDE DMP AREA, INSIDE TOTE. CORROSIVE DIAMOND HAZARD LABEL WAS CLEARLY VISIBLE, SO SHE DONNED PPE, INCLUDING SILVER SHIELD GLOVES, AND PROCEEDED TO NEUTRALIZE THE LEAKING ACID WITH SODIUM BICARBONATE. RESPONDER VERIFIED THAT THE SUBSTANCE WAS NEUTRALIZED USING PH TAPE. THE CONTAMINATED CARDBOARD, CLAY ABSORBANT, SODIUM BICARBONATE AND THE ENTIRE AUTOMOTIVE BATTERY WAS PLACED INSIDE A GREEN BAG. MORE SODIUM BICARBONATE AND CLAY ABSORBANT WERE ADDED TO THE BAG IN ORDER TO CATCH ANY MORE ACID THAT MAY LEAK FROM THE BATTERY.

  • Description: On June 20, 2024, one (1) 95-gallon overpack of sodium hypochlorite fell off of a skid and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. Crews re-secured the fallen tote. TLE personnel deployed granular absorbents and cleaners to impacted dock and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 35-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2024070000
item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-03T15:13:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-19
  • City: SAN LORENZO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 19, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN3265 was punctured by fallen freight and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ancon Services (AS) to remediate the impacted site. AS personnel utilized hand tools, neutralizers, granular absorbents and absorbent pads to the UN3265-impacted trailer floor, wooden slab, tote exterior and swept them up. AS deconstructed the wooden slab and conducted a gravity tote transfer into a new 330-gallon poly tote. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 30-gallon drum. The original tote was deconstructed with and collected into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum.

item.title: Report E-2024060133
item.description:
Report E-2024060133

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-03T15:13:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-04
  • City: CINCINNATI
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On Tuesday, 6/04/2024, at 1121 hours, an FRA Hazmat Inspector in the CSXT Queens Gate Yard discovered UTLX676824, a loaded tank car of Ammonium Nitrate, liquid, had leaked from the Vacuum Relief Valve (VRV). The car was isolated and the shipper, CF Industries Sales LLC, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report#2024-0604-00147). CSXT Hazmat personnel responded to the yard and observed dried product within the service equipment housing that had leaked from the VRV. The valve was not actively leaking at the time of response. The issue was identified as a defective Vacuum Relief Valve and corrective actions were communicated to the shippers representative, Roy Mathew, 224-804-7190, rmathew@cfindustries.com. The car was held out of transportation pending repair or replacement of the defective valve by a certified mobile repair unit.

item.title: Report E-2024060053
item.description:
Report E-2024060053

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-03T15:13:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-03
  • City: BOYKINS
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 6/3/24, at 1232 hours, personnel in the NCVA Railroad Boykins, VA Yard discovered GBRX709256, a loaded tank car of Sodium Hydroxide Solution, had leaked from the top of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Chemserve Terminals, was notified via CHEMTREC 2024060300092. Hepaco, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene as well as a representative from Chemserve Terminals and found the air line valve open and secondary closure plug not installed. The issue was identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shippers representative- Matt Law 757-544-0784. Contractor personnel closed the valve and reinstalled the plug and decontaminated the car. The leak was secured and the car was released for transport.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6550
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: The KAG Specialty Products Group, LLC driver arrived at the customer location and was preparing to initiate the delivery. It appears that a valve on the trailer was left in a partially open position. When the driver removed the discharge cap approximately 10 gallons of Bonderite C-IC was released. A portion of the spilled product sprayed on the driver and resulted in him seeking medical treatment. T&R Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

  • Description: Alexander Bretz, 042 Operations Supervisor, contacted Safety regarding a UN1294, Toluene, 3, PG II spill on the dock floor. Alexander advised the forklift operator was attempting to load the drum when he punctured the drum with the forklift causing the spill. Safety asked if any struck the yard, and Alexander advised not yet. Safety asked if he would be able to contain the spill to the dock area. Alexander advised yes. Alex with CURA was contacted for remediation. Alexander contacted Safety advising approximately 5 Gallons struck the yard. Safety advised Cura regarding the spill to the yard.

  • Description: Found by the FRA Hazmat with a leaking secondary closure plug. Upon inspection, the bottom outlet valve was found to be in the fully open position, even though the valve handle was closed and sealed. The valve operating stem had a sheared pin which did not close the valve. A pin was installed, the valve closed, and the plug properly secured. Eight of eight manway swing bolts were also less than tool tight and properly secured.

PACKAGE WAS WET FROM THE INSIDE AND NO EVIDENCE OF ANY OTHER LEAKAGE BESIDES WET CARDBOARD ON THE BOX. CAP OF INSIDE CONTAINER WAS TIGHT, NO SEAL UNDER CAP.

item.description:

  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A DESIGNATED RESPONDER TOOK THE CALL. THEY DONNED THEIR P.P.E. UPON VISUAL INSPECTIONS/ DISCOVERED THAT THE LEAKING PACKAGE WAS A DECLARED CORROSIVE 8 HAZMAT IN A 5-GALLON BUCKET WITH NO ADDITIONAL PACKAGING. RESPONDER USE THE DECISION-TREE AND BASED ON THE LABEL USED THE CORROSIVE RESPONSE SHEET. RESPONSDER CONTAINERIZED THE PACKAGE INTO A LINED SPILL TUB AND BROUGHT BACK TO THE PSC FOR PROCESSING. DONNED PPE AND MOVED THE LEAKER TO WORKAREA. REVIEWED PRODUCT AND SDS WITH RMP.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-01T15:12:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-26
  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XHG experienced a UN1791 Dynachlor release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 50-gallons of product released to a 10 x 30 area of the trailer floor and concrete lot below due to a puncture caused by dunnage. The material was transferred into a new tote for shipment on. Absorbents and citric acid were deployed to clean and neutralize the impacted areas. All impacted absorbents were collected into (3) 55-gallon poly drums. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized into a 4th 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • City: EDWARDSVILLE
  • State: IL

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractors arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 4ft-by-6ft area of the concrete/asphalt lot and estimated that three (3) gallons of material was released due to a fall during offloading that damaged seven (7) 5-gallon metal pails. Hepaco personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and recovered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was transported to the nearest Dayton Freight terminal for terminal personnel to coordinate disposal. The seven (7) damaged pails were containerized into two (2) 55-gallon metal drums and placed into the Dayton Freight trailer for transport to the nearest terminal.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A leaking container of hydrogen peroxide and peroxyacetic acid was discovered at the Menomonee Falls 10-Day Dock while unloading a trailer at the 10 day intransit facility in Menomonee Falls, WI. The cardboard container was saturated with the liquid, and needed to be repackaged, as well as handled appropriately by a reactives trained Menomonee Falls Field Service employee. An investigation revealed the source of the spill was due to the closure not being secured on the inner package allowing for material to leak out of the top.

item.title: Report E-2024060665
item.description:
Report E-2024060665

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-01T15:12:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-19
  • City: TULSA
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 19, 2024, nine (9) 5-gallon pails of paint were dropped during loading and released approximately fifteen (15) gallons of product to the concrete surface. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works (EW) to remediate the impacted site. Before EW personnel arrived, personnel from the customer location attempted to clean the paint with a power washer, spreading the paint out through the parking lot. Crews deployed granular absorbent to the concrete and worked them in with hand tools. Once all free product was collected, crews utilized a power washer to further remediate the surface area and added the rinsate to the existing drums of waste. All paint-impacted material was collected and containerized in four (4) 55-gallon drums for transport and disposal.

R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. EWI personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and the damaged pail of UN1210 was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

One damaged drum of UN1263 was containerized in one (1) 95-gallon over pack drum, and all spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. All waste was left onsite.

Upon the personnel observed that the released material impacted a 1ft-by-3ft area of the trailer wall and estimated that forty (40) cardboard packages containing 1-gallon each was damaged from a load shift and released approximately five (5) gallons of material. Clean Harbors personnel deployed a cleaner to the impacted area and used absorbent rags to recover the spent material. The impacted rags were containerized along with impacted cardboard into five (5) 55-gallon poly drums. The generated waste was staged onsite at the consignees location. A second response the next day at the terminal resulted in one (1) ounce of material leaking from the repalletized packages. The contractor deployed a cleaner again to the impacted area of the trailer floor and used absorbent rags to recover the spent material. Clean Harbors generated two (2) additional 55-gallon poly drums. The two (2) drums of waste were staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024060468
item.description:
Report E-2024060468

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-01T15:12:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-10
  • City: NORTH RIDGEVILLE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractors arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 3ft-by-2ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that one (1) gallon of material was released due to a puncture to one (1) poly tote. Hepaco personnel stated that prior to their arrival ESTES terminal personnel had cleaned the impacted area. The area was tested and confirmed as neutralized. The spent material was containerized into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The remaining product in the damaged tote was transferred to a new tote. The empty tote was cut up and placed into two (2) cubic yard boxes. All the generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 275000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Remote control locomotive operator free rolled 5 load tank cars from the switching lead into class track 20 which struck tank car CTCX 730096. The B-end stub sill buckled causing the tank shell to crush in on itself. The B-end head shoe pulled the outer most point of repad off the tank shell. The repad continued to be pulled away from the tank shell towards the center of the car until the tank shell tore vertically at the body bolster.

item.title: Report X-2024061446
item.description:
Report X-2024061446

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-01T15:12:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-07
  • City: DRAPER
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 6/7/2024 at approximately 0900, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 619462 at the station location in Draper, reporting an undeclared paint spill. The shipment consisted of 3 plastic buckets packaged inside of a fiberboard box. One of the buckets spilled due to a failed closure. Further inspection of the shipment revealed that the package was not prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations. The shipment did not have the required markings. labeling, packaging or paperwork for air transport. The shipment is being held pending an FAA investigation.
